directives.label: def-walker
directives.title: Walker
directives.content:
A **walker**, denoted $w$, is a tuple consisting of a position and a status:

$$
w := (x, s)
$$

where:
1.  $x \in \mathcal{X}$ is the walker's **position** in a state space $\mathcal{X}$.
2.  $s \in ...

directives.label: def-swarm-and-state-space
directives.title: Swarm and Swarm State Space
directives.content:
A **swarm**, denoted $\mathcal{S}$, is an N-tuple of walkers:

$$
\mathcal{S} := (w_1, w_2, \dots, w_N)
$$

The **Swarm State Space**, denoted $\Sigma_N$, is the set of all possible swarms of size N. ...

directives.label: def-alive-dead-sets
directives.title: Alive and Dead Sets
directives.content:
For any swarm state $\mathcal{S} = ((x_1, s_1), \dots, (x_N, s_N)) \in \Sigma_N$:

1.  The **alive set**, $\mathcal{A}(\mathcal{S})$, is the set of indices of all walkers with a survival status of 1.
...

directives.label: def-valid-state-space
directives.title: Valid State Space
directives.content:
A **Valid State Space** is a tuple $(\mathcal{X}, d_{\mathcal{X}}, \mu_{\mathcal{X}})$ with the following properties:

1.  **Topological Structure:** The space $(\mathcal{X}, d_{\mathcal{X}})$ must be...

directives.label: def-ambient-euclidean
directives.title: Ambient Euclidean Structure and Reference Measures
directives.content:
- The spaces $\mathcal{X} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ and $\mathcal{Y} \subset \mathbb{R}^m$ are finite-dimensional Euclidean domains with Lebesgue reference measures $\lambda_d$ and $\lambda_m$.
- All line...

directives.label: def-reference-measures
directives.title: Reference Noise and Kernel Families
directives.content:
- **Perturbation kernels on $\mathcal{X}$ (dimension $d$):**
  - Gaussian: $\xi \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \sigma^2 I_d)$ so that $\mathbb{E}[\|\xi\|_2^2] = d\,\sigma^2$.
  - Uniform ball: $\xi$ uniform on $...

directives.title: N-Particle Displacement Pseudometric ($d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}$)
directives.content:
For any two swarms, $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$, define the (pseudo)metric by

$$
d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)
:= \Bigg( \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N d_{\mathcal{Y}}\!...

directives.label: lem-polishness-and-w2
directives.title: Polishness of the quotient state space and $W_2$
directives.content: If $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ is Polish and $N<\infty$, then the Kolmogorov quotient $(\overline{\Sigma}_N, \overline d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}})$ induced by the displacement pseudometric is Po...

directives.label: def-displacement-components
directives.title: Components of Swarm Displacement
directives.content:
For any two swarms, $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$, their total displacement is decomposed into two fundamental components:

1.  **The Squared Positional Displacement ($\Delta_{\text{pos}}^2$):**...

directives.content:
Fix a time $t$ and swarm state $\mathcal S_t$. For each walker $i\in\{1,\dots,N\}$, let

$$
X_i \;:=\;\big(U_i^{\mathrm{comp}},\,U_i^{\mathrm{pert}},\,U_i^{\mathrm{status}},\,U_i^{\mathrm{clone}}\big)...

directives.label: def-axiom-guaranteed-revival
directives.title: Axiom of Guaranteed Revival
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The cloning score generated by a dead walker must be guaranteed to exceed the maximum possible random threshold, $p_{\max}$.
*   **Axiomatic Parameter ($\kappa_{\text{revival}...

directives.label: thm-revival-guarantee
directives.title: Almost‑sure revival under the global constraint
directives.content: Assume the global constraint $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}\,p_{\max} < \eta^{\alpha+\beta}$. Let $\mathcal S$ be any swarm with at least one alive walker ($|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|\ge 1$) and let $i\in\...
directives.first_math: \mathbb P\big[\text{$i$ is revived in the cloning stage}\big] \;=\;1.

directives.label: def-axiom-boundary-regularity
directives.title: Axiom of Boundary Regularity
directives.content: *   **Core Assumption:** The marginal probability of a single walker becoming invalid after the perturbation and status update stages must be a smooth (Hölder continuous) function of the initial N-par...

directives.label: def-axiom-boundary-smoothness
directives.title: Axiom of Boundary Smoothness
directives.content: *   **Core Assumption:** The boundary of the valid domain, $\partial \mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{valid}}$, must be a $(d-1)$‑dimensional continuously differentiable ($C^1$) submanifold of the $d$‑dimensional...

directives.label: def-axiom-environmental-richness
directives.title: Axiom of Environmental Richness
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The reward function $R$ must not be pathologically flat at a user-defined minimum length scale. The algorithm requires a guaranteed level of reward variation to learn.
*   **A...

directives.label: def-axiom-reward-regularity
directives.title: Axiom of Reward Regularity
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The reward function, when viewed in the algorithmic space, must be Hölder continuous.

*   **Axiomatic Parameters:** The user must provide the constants that bound the reward ...

directives.label: def-axiom-bounded-algorithmic-diameter
directives.title: Axiom of Bounded Algorithmic Diameter
directives.content:
- The algorithmic space $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ is Polish (complete, separable metric space).
- Its diameter is finite: $D_{\mathcal{Y}} := \operatorname{diam}_{d_{\mathcal{Y}}}(\mathcal{Y}) ...

directives.label: def-axiom-range-respecting-mean
directives.title: Range‑Respecting Mean
directives.content:
For any finite collection of inputs $\{v_i\}$, the aggregator’s mean output $\mu$ satisfies

$$
\min_i v_i \;\le\; \mu \;\le\; \max_i v_i.
$$

This property holds for empirical means and is assumed fo...

directives.title: Valid Noise Measure
directives.content:

directives.title: Axiom of Sufficient Amplification
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The dynamics weights must be configured to actively process measurement signals.
*   **Axiomatic Parameter ($\kappa_{\text{amplification}}$ - The Amplification Strength):** Th...

directives.label: def-axiom-non-degenerate-noise
directives.title: Axiom of Non-Degenerate Noise
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The **Perturbation** and **Cloning** measures must not be the Dirac delta measure.
*   **Axiomatic Parameters ($\sigma$, $\delta$ - The Noise Scales):** The user provides thes...

directives.title: Components of Mean-Square Standardization Error

directives.content:

directives.content:

*   **Axiomatic Parameter ($c_{...

directives.title: Axiom of Bounded Deviation from Aggregated Variance
directives.content: *   **Core Assumption:** The sum of squared deviations of the raw input values from the aggregator's computed mean must be controllably related to the variance computed by the aggregator itself. This ...

directives.label: def-axiom-bounded-variance-production
directives.title: Axiom of Bounded Variance Production
directives.content: *   **Core Assumption:** The variance of the measure produced by the aggregation operator must itself be bounded by a function of the input value range. This prevents an aggregator from creating arbit...

directives.label: def-axiom-geometric-consistency
directives.title: Axiom of Geometric Consistency
directives.content:
*   **Core Assumption:** The algorithmic noise should be unbiased and isotropic, unless intentionally designed otherwise.

This theorem is beautiful because it guarantees the swarm can never get completely stuck! Here's the intuition:

directives.content:
There exists a uniform margin $r_{\mathrm{pos}}>0$ such that for any two swarms $\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2\in\Sigma_N$ with

$$
\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N d_{\mathcal Y}\!\big(\varphi(x_{1,i}),\varphi(...

directives.label: def-reward-measurement

directives.content: The reward value $r_i$ for walker $i$ at position $x_i$ is the result of integrating the global Reward Function $R$ against the walker's **positional measure**, which is the Dirac delta measure $\delt...

directives.label: def-perturbation-measure
directives.title: Perturbation Measure
directives.content: For a given noise scale $\sigma > 0$, the **Perturbation Measure**, $\mathcal{P}_\sigma(x, \cdot)$, is a **Valid Noise Measure** according to Definition 2.3. It governs the random walks during the per...

directives.title: Cloning Measure
directives.content: For a given cloning noise scale $\delta > 0$, the **Cloning Measure**, $\mathcal{Q}_\delta(x, \cdot)$, is a **Valid Noise Measure** according to Definition 2.3. It governs the displacement for newly c...

directives.label: def-algorithmic-space-generic
directives.title: Algorithmic Space
directives.content: An **algorithmic space** is a pair $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ consisting of a real vector space $\mathcal{Y}$ and a true metric $d_{\mathcal{Y}}$ on $\mathcal{Y}$.

directives.label: def-distance-positional-measures

directives.label: def-alg-distance
directives.title: Algorithmic Distance
directives.content: The **algorithmic distance** $d_{\text{alg}}\colon\mathcal{X}\times\mathcal{X}\to\mathbb{R}_{\ge0}$ is the distance between the projected positional measures of two walkers. In practice, this is the d...

directives.content: For any $z_max > 1$, there exists a unique cubic polynomial $P(z)$ that satisfies the four $C¹$ boundary conditions specified in [](#def-asymmetric-rescale-function).

directives.label: lem-rescale-monotonicity
directives.title: Monotonicity of the Smooth Rescale Function
directives.content: The $Smooth Piecewise Rescale Function$ $g_A(z)$ is monotonically non-decreasing on $ℝ$.

directives.label: thm-rescale-function-lipschitz
directives.title: Global Lipschitz Continuity of the Smooth Rescale Function
directives.content: The **Smooth Piecewise Rescale Function** $g_A(z)$ is globally Lipschitz continuous on $\mathbb{R}$. Its Lipschitz constant, $L_{g_A}$, is the supremum of the absolute value of its first derivative, a...

directives.label: def-canonical-logistic-rescale-function-example
directives.title: Canonical Logistic Rescale Function
directives.content:
The **Canonical Logistic Rescale Function** $g_A: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$ is defined as:
$$

g_A(z) := \frac{2}{1 + e^{-z}}

$$

directives.label: def-raw-value-operator
directives.title: Raw Value Operator
directives.content:
A **Raw Value Operator**, denoted $V$, is a function that maps a swarm state $S \in \Sigma_N$ to a **probability distribution** over N-dimensional real-valued vectors, $P(\mathbb{R}^N)$.
